most_active_tickets.title: Pieces OS & Pieces Desktop fail to start after last update.  stucks at loading
Unable to open Pieces Settings Service

common_issues.title: Pieces OS/Desktop Startup Failure After Update
common_issues.description: Users are unable to launch Pieces Desktop after updating Pieces OS. The app hangs on "Ensure Core Dependencies" screen.  Reinstalling doesn't resolve the issue. Logs indicate Pieces OS service fails to start.  Problem observed on Windows 11 and MacOS. Workaround:  Potentially deleting all local Pieces data, but data loss risk.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS & Pieces Desktop fail to start after last update.  stucks at loading
related_issues.text: Pieces OS & Pieces Desktop fail to start after last update. stucks at loading ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Desktop Application, Pieces OS ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.2.1.0 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. For over a month I have been unable to use **Pieces OS** or **Pieces Desktop**. The Pieces OS service stopped working (I assume after the last update), and since then the desktop app no longer starts properly. Whenever I try to launch, the `Pieces` process starts but never progresses further. In **Pieces Desktop** I only see the message: _Ensure Core Dependencies Retry Step_ I’ve seen another user reporting a similar issue, but my case seems different (I’m attaching logs below). Unfortunately, this is not the first time I’ve faced problems with Pieces.... I’ve already lost all my history/snippets about three times in the past (distinct bugs). This situation is quite frustrating. ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Install/update to the latest version of Pieces OS on Windows 11. 2. Launch Pieces Desktop. 3. Observe that the app does not open and gets stuck with the “Ensure Core Dependencies” message. ### Expected Behavior Pieces OS should start normally and allow Pieces Desktop to connect and function. ### Actual Behavior - Pieces OS process starts but hangs. - Pieces Desktop shows “Ensure Core Dependencies – Retry Step”. - Reinstalling from scratch does not solve the issue. ### System Information - **OS**: Windows 11 - **Processor**: Intel x64-based - **Pieces OS**: 12.2.1.0 - **Pieces Desktop**: 4.34 ### Troubleshooting Attempted - Tried reinstalling Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop from scratch → issue persists. - I noticed a similar issue has been reported, but I’m not sure it is directly related to what I’m experiencing. - I suspect that completely deleting all local data/configuration files could be a final solution, but this would cause me to lose all my snippets/history (which has already happened before). I’d prefer to avoid this unless it’s confirmed as the only fix. ### Logs [Support logs.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/22142467/Support.zip) ### Additional... If this issue is already being tracked, that’s fine. If not, I’ll attempt to wipe all Pieces data and retry, though I suspect some leftover files/data may be blocking the reinstall. Thanks in advance for your support! recommendations: Prioritize resolving the "Pieces OS/Desktop Startup Failure After Update" issue as it has the highest frequency and impacts both Windows and MacOS users.
Investigate the root cause of the startup failure. Logs suggest a problem with the Pieces OS service initialization.
Improve error messaging and logging to provide more specific information about the startup failure, aiding in faster diagnosis.
Develop a troubleshooting guide or FAQ for users experiencing startup issues after updates.
Consider implementing a rollback mechanism for Pieces OS updates to mitigate the impact of faulty updates.
